content: colorwork pattern following the chart make increases for the thumb as shown to form the thumb gusset the orange dotted lines are marking convenient places to divide the stitches across your needles but it s not necessary to follow those guidelines do what works best for you all increases are done using m1a to decrease use ssk on the right side and k2tog on the left side to finish the top of the mitten and thumb thread the end of the yarn through the final 8 stitches and pull tight thumb when you get to the double line in the pattern where the thumb will be knit those 11 stitches onto a piece of scrap yarn then move those stitches back to the left-hand needle and knit them again following the chart when you are done with the body of the mitten pick up the stitches above and below the scrap yarn and remove that piece of yarn you will have 11 stitches across the top and bottom of the thumb hole distribute these stitches as you like to begin working rounds 3 needles work well for me knit a round picking up one extra stitch on each corner of the thumb for a total of 24 stitches then follow the pattern for the thumb remember to use the other side of the chart for the second mitten block and weave in ends ©2018 stefanie canich norwegian selbu mittens page 2 norwegian selbu mitten chart this is for a right mitten be sure to reverse this chart for a left mitten thumb ©2018 stefanie canich norwegian selbu mittens page 3 norwegian selbu mittens chart for both hands right mitten front - same for both hands left mitten thumb ©2018 stefanie canich norwegian selbu mittens page 4
